page.title: 14THE BEACH NEAR CARNOUSTIE
page.content: The stretch of{coastline}in this area is excellent for its{rock pools. There is a twice-daily tide cycle and different things can be seen at the various stages of the tide. The movement of the large boulders makes them grind away at the bedrock underneath until huge{potholes}are formed. These, of course, provide homes for creatures which have to be constantly surrounded by salt water. {Starfish}and{sea-urchins}abound as do many kinds of{crab. }Indeed there are no fewer than 13 types of crab and {lobster}to be found. The most common is the{Green Shore Crab,}others are the{Edible Crab, Common Spider Crab and the{Hermit Crab.} Many interesting shells are also to be found. There are{limpets, periwinkles, {scallops, whelks, cowries, {mussels, cockles}and{razor shells.
